text:
How can I rename multiple columns in my dataframe to be the same as the first row below them? In my case, I'd like to do this to every 3rd column. I'm considering using something like this if it works but not sure where to take it from here:

```rename!(df, [Symbol("col$i") for i in 2:3:94]```

elements.text: How can I rename multiple columns in my dataframe to be the same as the first row below them? In my case, I'd like to do this to every 3rd column. I'm considering using something like this if it works but not sure where to take it from here:

text:
I don't know what "same as first row below them" means. But you can rename with a vector of pairs.

```cols_to_rename = names(df)[2:3:94]
rename!(df, cols_to_rename .=> (cols_to_rename .* "_new"))```

elements.text: I don't know what "same as first row below them" means. But you can rename with a vector of pairs.

text: <@UBF9YRB6H> Yeah I think I'm calling it the wrong thing but what I mean is that I'd like for the columns to be renamed to whatever is the value in the first row of  that column

elements.text: Yeah I think I'm calling it the wrong thing but what I mean is that I'd like for the columns to be renamed to whatever is the value in the first row of  that column

text: <@UBF9YRB6H> So if the value in the first row of one of these columns is 520, 520 would become that columns' name. The next column would be renamed to525 if that's the value of the first row under it.

elements.text: So if the value in the first row of one of these columns is 520, 520 would become that columns' name. The next column would be renamed to525 if that's the value of the first row under it.

text:
```for cols in cols_to_rename
    newname = string(first(df[!, col]))
    rename!(df, col => newname)
end```

<@UBF9YRB6H>
```cols_to_rename = names(df)[2:3:94]
for cols in cols_to_rename
    newname = string(first(df[!, col]))
    rename!(df, col => newname)
end```
 I'm getting this error:
```ERROR: UndefVarError: col not defined

text: Just a typo on my end. Switched `for cols` into    `for col`  and it worked!
